p: In a study, a combination of five EOs with seven antibiotics have been investigated; the combined effect of peppermint, cinnamon bark, and lavender EO with piperacillin, peppermint, and meropenem showed significant synergistic effects against various E. coli strains [ 25, 107, 108]. In a different study, the fractional inhibitory concentration (FIC) of EO was evaluated, and the data showed promising outcome against fungal and bacterial species [ 109, 110]. Hence, when more than one EO were combined, a greater efficacy was achieved. Oregano and thyme EO combined showed synergistic effects against different fungal species studied with FIC ≤0.5, except for Aspergillus niger, which that displayed an additive effect with an FIC value of 0.75 ± 0.16. Moreover, a synergistic effect was found between carvacrol and thymol, which are compounds contained in thyme and oregano, respectively, to have a synergistic effect against Penicillium spp, A. flavus, and Fusarium species with FIC ≤ 0.5. A synergistic effect was also reported between carvacrol and thyme EO that showed an enhanced effectiveness against S. typhimurium [ 109, 110].
